body:
Currently when creating an index for a repo and packaging it, the name can end up in an invalid name:

```
helm install nats/NATS nats
Error: create: failed to create: Secret "sh.helm.release.v1.NATS-1582586379.v1" is invalid: metadata.name: Invalid value: "sh.helm.release.v1.NATS-1582586379.v1": a DNS-1123 subdomain must consist of lower case alphanumeric characters, '-' or '.', and must start and end with an alphanumeric character (e.g. 'example.com', regex used for validation is '[a-z0-9]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?(\.[a-z0-9]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?)*')
```

Although `helm lint` shows no errors from the chart related to name being in uppercase:
```
helm lint
==> Linting .
[INFO] Chart.yaml: icon is recommended

1 chart(s) linted, 0 chart(s) failed
```

Output of `helm version`:
```
 helm version
version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.0.3", GitCommit:"ac925eb7279f4a6955df663a0128044a8a6b7593", GitTreeState:"clean", GoVersion:"go1.13.7"}
```

Output of `kubectl version`:

```
kubectl version
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"15", GitVersion:"v1.15.0", GitCommit:"e8462b5b5dc2584fdcd18e6bcfe9f1e4d970a529", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-06-20T04:49:16Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.6", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"darwin/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"12+", GitVersion:"v1.12.10-eks-aae39f", GitCommit:"aae39f4697508697bf16c0de4a5687d464f4da81", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-12-23T08:19:12Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.9", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```
title: `helm lint` should validate chart is using lowercase letters
